Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
•
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 (1) Behavior Management
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually and
updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents, their
families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/22/22, youth and staff engaged in an argument when reviewing
youth's expectations for the day. Staff member was going to write youth
up and youth stepped into the office. Staff member yelled at youth for
coming into the office and shoved youth with one hand and then again
with both hands. Other staff stepped in to de-escalate this.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2/ Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on December
27, 2022, and face to face at the facility on January 3, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported on December
22, 2022, Youth A came out of his room in a negative head space upon
waking up. Staff 1 began to redirect Youth A to get his morning tasks
completed. Staff 2 reported he heard Staff 1 tell Youth A if he did not
complete his reading then he would be marked as unsafe which upset
Youth A. He indicated he did not hear Staff 1 give choices but a
directive of what to do and she was unhappy with his attitude. Staff 2
reported during this time, he was sitting in the milieu area with Youth D
and could watch the situation from where he was seated. He reported
he may have had his cell phone out but does not remember and
reported he knows he was not scrolling through his phone. It should be
noted that staff are allowed to have personal cell phones out during
their shift as that is how staff will communicate with one another
through personal cell phones. Staff 2 reported Youth A continued to be
escalated. Staff 1 went into the office to change the board to indicate
Youth A was being unsafe. Staff 2 reported Youth A followed her into
the office and was about to step inside the doorway. When Staff 1 went
to leave the office, she was about one foot away when she shoved
Youth A with one hand on one arm and then two hands. Staff 2
reported this caused Youth A to take a step backwards and denied
Youth A fell. Staff 2 reported he did not hear Staff 1 say anything while
she was in the office such as telling Youth A space was needed. He
reported Staff 1 also did not ask for any assistance from Staff 2 during
this incident. He reported he never saw Youth A try to swing at Staff 1
but reported he could have missed this. Staff 2 reported he is 100%
certain when Staff 1 put her right hand to Youth A’s upper right arm that
this was push because it looked like she put her body weight into that

push. He reported the second time she put her hands up it may have
been more of a block to get out of the situation. Staff 2 reported the
situation he saw between Staff 1 and Youth A lasted about one minute.
He reported he heard Youth B make the comment to Youth A to not
touch Staff 1. Staff 2 reported once he heard Youth B make that
comment he got up and saw Staff 1 leave the office space and he stood
in between Youth A and Youth B as they got escalated between one
another. Staff 2 reported he does not remember Youth C being present
there and reported Staff 3 was in the kitchen area making food. Staff 2
reported he spoke with Therapist, Staff 5 and Supervisor 2 about these
concerns. Staff 2 reported Youth A does have a safety plan where he
cannot be left alone with female staff and this safety plan was followed
as Staff 2 was out in the milieu area. He reported staff are to never
push a youth at the facility and are trained that in their de-escalation
training. Staff 2 reported he was surprised that Staff 1 did this but
reported that she has been frustrated with the changes in the program
of using ABA programing.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he
does not fully remember everything that happened with Staff 1. He
reported there was incident where Staff 1 was marking his behavior as
unsafe on the chart because he was yelling at people. Youth A reported
he then went towards the staff office because he wanted to call his
parent to help calm down. He reported Staff 1 was by the office, and he
was by the office door. Youth A reported Staff 1 told him he needed to
do his reading first. Youth A reported he remembered Staff 1 held out
one arm and then pushed him with two hands on his arms. He reported
when Staff 1 had her hands on him, she asked him to leave the office
and then pushed him. He reported that no one else saw this happen
and that he did not fall when Staff 1 pushed him. Youth A reported after
this occurred, he went to calm down and Staff 1 left the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on
December 22, 2022, Youth A woke up with an attitude. She reported
Youth A did not want to do his job. She reported she told Youth A if he
did not want to do his job then he could not go to the movies that was
planned. Staff 1 reported Youth A continued to scream, and this began
to affect his peers’ attitudes. Staff 1 admitted she did not clearly give
Youth A other choices but explained to him that he needed to follow his
routine. She reported she went into the office to make some phone
calls and Youth A followed her into the office. Staff 1 reported at this
point she knew she was the target for Youth A’s negative behavior, and
he asked her who she was calling. Staff 1 reported she remained calm
and told Youth A he did not need to know this information. She reported

Youth A began to mess with the white out in the staff office and she
asked him to leave to office. Youth A said “no” at first and then began to
walk out of the physical office. Staff 1 reported she tried to close the
office door and Youth A put his hand on the office door so that she
could not close it and stood in the doorway. She reported Youth A then
tried to hit her by swinging his arms around. She reported Youth A got
within a foot of her face, so she asked for space. She admitted to
extending her arm out in front of her as she took a step backward. She
reported Youth A then began to try to intimidate her and he stepped
forward toward her arm. Staff 1 reported she does not know if her hand
touched Youth A’s chest, but she never pushed him out of the way. She
reported she asked Youth A to please leave and to give space
numerous times. She reported Youth A left the situation once Youth C
was yelling and Staff 2 got up. Staff 1 reported this situation with Youth
A lasted about two to three minutes. Throughout this situation, Staff 1
reported she never yelled at Youth A or pushed him. She reported
Staff 2 was sitting in the milieu with Youth D as his one-to-one staffing.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 had his back to the situation and does not
believe he saw anything and got up once he heard Youth C. She
reported Youth D was laying on the couch and believes Staff 2 was on
his cell phone. Staff 1 admitted she did not ask for help from Staff 2
during this situation. Staff 1 reported she tries to remain calm in all of
these situations, so she does not get hurt. Staff 1 reported she is aware
of Youth A’s safety plan on how she is not to be left alone with him
which she reported she was not because Staff 2 was in the milieu at the
time. Staff 1 reported she never marked Youth A unsafe on his charting
until after he attempted to swing at her. She reported at the facility staff
are prohibited to push a youth and reported she would never do that.
Staff 1 reported she felt she did nothing wrong and handled the
situation to the best of her ability. She reported she did not push Youth
A, attempted to be block the swings from Youth A and was trying to get
out of an unsafe situation.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
Staff 1 gets along with everyone and that he has never seen her push a
youth at the facility. Youth B reported Youth A will get mad sometimes
when he is told no or what to do. Youth B reported he remembers
something happening with Youth A and Staff 1 the other day but does
not remember exactly what happened. He reported Youth A has been
saying Staff 1 did something to him but cannot remember what it was.
Youth B reported Youth A is known to lie.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she
works with Staff 1 a lot and has never seen her put her hands on a

youth. She reported she is a good staff member, gets along with all the
staff and youth, and shows no concerning behaviors. Staff 3 reported
when Youth A is having a bad day he can be in an escalated state
where he can threaten to hurt others. She reported Staff 1 would run
away from a youth before she would lay hands on a youth. Staff 3
reported when she was redirecting Youth A the other day for bouncing
a ball, Youth A told her she cannot tell him what to do and that is why
Staff 1 is getting fired because she told me what to do. Staff 3 reported
Youth A stopped bouncing the ball once she ignored his behavior. Staff
3 reported at the facility a staff member cannot put hands on a youth
unless they are doing extreme harm to themselves or others. She
reported staff are all trained that they cannot push the youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he
gets along well with Staff 1 and has never seen her push anyone. He
reported Youth A pushed Staff 1 when he was angry that he could not
get his ID out of the office. Youth C reported he does not remember
exactly when this happened, but it was on a weekend, and it was cold
outside. He reported Youth A pushed with both of his hands on Staff 1
and she told him to back up. Youth C reported that is all he remembers.
Youth D was attempted to be interviewed on January 3, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker but was unsuccessful due to
Youth D’s cognitive delay and limited verbal skills.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 1 reported she was not working when the incident occurred.
She stated Staff 1 is a great staff and has been employed with the
facility for over two years. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 has not had any
disciplinary actions and has had coaching on her confidence when
working with the youth. She reported Staff 1 had a youth attack her
about a year ago and give her a concussion which kept her out of work
for 6 months. Since that incident Staff 1 has been timid when a youth is
in an escalated state due to past trauma.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported
after the incident occurred on December 22, 2022, Staff 2 came to him
to process the situation and asked how to document. Therapist was
consistent with the information provide in Staff 2’s interview. Therapist
reported Youth A does have a safety plan in place due to aggressive
behaviors with female staff.

Supervisor 3 and Staff 5 were interviewed separately via phone on
January 6, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 3 and Staff 5 both reported they heard second hand from
Staff 2 about the incident that occurred with Youth A and Staff 1. What
Staff 2 told them is consistent with Staff 2’s interview. Both Supervisor 3
and Staff 5 noted Youth A has a history of aggression with female staff
and has as safe plan around this. When Supervisor 3 and Staff 5 were
asked about behavior management on the unit they reported providing
youth choices and staff teaming in heighten situations with youth needs
to be reenforced.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she
was not working when the incident occurred with Staff 1 and Youth A.
Staff 4 reported Youth A does have a safety plan that he should never
be left alone with a single female staff.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on January 19, 2022.
MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to their investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wedgwood incident report dated December 22, 2022-
Incident reported was completed by Staff 2 and constant with his
interview. Staff 2 reported when Staff 1 was in the staff office,
Youth A was standing in the office door and Staff 1 shoved
Youth A with one arm telling him to move out of the way then
proceeded to shove Youth A again with two arms. Youth A
stated to Staff 1 to not touch him and began to intimidate Staff 1
by staring her down close to her face. Staff 1 began to walk
away when Staff 2 intervened and began to verbally deescalate
Youth A.
• Email from Supervisor 3 dated January 5, 2022- Supervisor 3
is one of the facilities AEGIS trainers. He reported “AEGIS does
not have any specific moves regarding blocking. What we do
teach is defensive positioning, which is putting your hands up in
front of you should you need to fend off any attempted strikes.
We do not push or strike a client while doing this, but we can
demonstrate and role model how much space is appropriate. We
also position ourselves to keep everyone safe by doing a
number of things, including backing up from an aggressive client,
standing not directly in front of an aggressive client, and creating
as much space as is necessary to maintain everyone’s safety.
This also includes staff using a hand up to role model
appropriate space.” From this email is consistent with Staff 1’s

attempt to create space by putting her hand up to show the
appropriate space.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan dated December 6, 2022- Youth A is to
not be alone, one-on-one, with a female staff member at any
time. He will not be alone on the unit with a single, female staff
and peer.
• Wedgwood’s Behavior Management Procedures-Prohibited
Techniques- Prohibited Behavior Management Techniques at
the facility includes corporal or physical punishment including
spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping, or hair pulling.
• Wedgwood’s Behavior Management Procedures- Staff are to
first employ preventive and/or supportive behavior management
techniques, including a variety of de-escalation approaches and
activation of client self-control plans. When an environment that
is excessively controlled by the staff is at risk for disruption and
offers fewer opportunities for youth to make choices and
exercise the responsibility of self-control. The treatment team
should develop skill and finesse in each of its members in
sensing when it time to step in, when to selectively ignore, and
when to encourage alternatives.
• Wedgwood Crisis Management Procedures- Physical
Management may only occur with a client whose behavior is
significantly dangerous to self or others. Physical Management is
performed according to the current techniques of the “Aegis
System”, Wedgwood’s approved crisis intervention program. The
use of force and duration of restraint must be limited to that
which is necessary to ensure the optimal care, welfare, safety,
and security of all. Restraint techniques must never be used for
punishment, discipline, or retaliation.
• HR File and Training Log for Staff 1- Within Staff 1’s HR file
there was one verbal warning for tardiness for shift. There were
no disciplinary actions related to the treatment of the youth. Staff
1 is up to date on all required training. Staff 1 completed the
required restraint training, “Crisis Prevention and De-escalation
Recert” on 11/17/2022.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of following their behavioral
management policy. Throughout this investigation it was found Staff 1
did not give Youth A choices or ask for team support from Staff 2 when
trying to get Youth A out of the office. Staff 2 was concerned with the
interactions between Staff 1 and Youth A from the start of the day but
did support the situation until another youth became involved. Staff 1
and Youth C denied Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Youth A and Staff 2
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Staff 2 acknowledged he didn’t

witness the entire interaction and Staff 1 reported she used her hands
to provide space and block Youth A as he attempted to hit her.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the that the current license status be continued.
